title: Pitbull Staying In Florida To Protect Family From Hurricane Dorian, Cancels LA Concert
text:
Singer Pitbull has been forced to cancel his concert in Los Angeles tonight, he has decided to stay back in Florida and ensure the safety of his family.

The Miami native just released a statement saying, "Due to Hurricane Dorian’s fast changing weather conditions approaching South Florida and the Eastern Seaboard tonight’s concert has been postponed until September 12. We’re sorry to disappoint fans, but are excited to hit the stage on the new rescheduled date."

A spokesperson for the venue, the LA County Fair, also addressed the situation giving their prayers to anyone affected.

"Due to Hurricane Dorian, the Pitbull concert at the LA County Fair has been tentatively rescheduled for Thursday, Sept. 12 at 7:30 p.m.

According to Pitbull’s management, the artist cannot safely depart from Miami. Pitbull, a resident of Miami, has chosen to stay and tend to the safety of his family.

Any ticket holders who planned to attend the Pitbull concert today may still use their ticket to visit the LA County Fair today, Sunday, Sept. 1. Admission will also be honored on the rescheduled date of the concert Thursday, Sept. 12.

Our thoughts are with all affected families along the Southeastern seaboard." officials for the LA County Fair wrote.

Hurricane Dorian just slammed into the Bahamas and will make its way to the Florida coast tonight.

Harrowing images from the destruction have started to make their way onto social media and newscasts.

Celebrity Chef José Andrés made his way Sunday to the Bahamas and his charity has “kitchens ready to go and shelters mapped out."

Andrés shared footage of himself where he said he was around 80 miles away from the eye of the storm.

"Let's pray for everybody" the chef says in the video. The footage is scary as the 180 mph winds rages around him as he addresses the public.
description: Pitbull Staying In Florida To Protect Family From Hurricane
